page.title: 17FARMING :DRAYTON BASSETT
page.content: Farming in the area around the villages of Drayton Bassett and hints falls into two categories : 1. arable farming (wheat,barley,potatoes) 2. dairy farming on pasture and rough grazing. Arable farms are large in size (400 acres) often consisting of 2 or 3 seperate farms amalgamated into one unit, with large fields, capital intensive, highly mechanised. Dairy farms are much smaller (50-80 acres), usually single family farms with one herd and small pasture fields divided by hedgerows. Many small-holdings are disappearing, merged into larger economic concerns, with large arable fields (100 acres+), hedges removed, suitable for modern machinery, using maximum growing area. Dairy farming is giving way to more profitable arable farming.
